title: Venezuelan Bolivares to U.S. Dollar Spot Exchange Rate
units: Venezuelan Bolivares to One U.S. Dollar
notes:
Starting Monday, October 4, 2021, the Venezuelan bolivar was redenominated by dividing the previous rate by 1,000,000. For more information about this series and any other news regarding the H.10 Foreign Exchange Rates visit here (https://www.federalreserve.gov/feeds/h10.html).  

The average exchange rate for the Venezuelan bolivar was determined using the "bolivar fuerte" rate through Friday August 17, 2018. Starting Monday August 20, 2018 the redenominated currency is "bolivar soberano" rate multiplied by 100,000.

Noon buying rates in New York City for cable transfers payable in foreign currencies.
